item.title: 杰克逊霍尔八大收获
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 农作物巡回考察发现玉米产量创纪录，但高温和病害是风险所在
item.description: 根据 Pro Farmer 周五在其年度作物巡查结束后发布的最终估计，美国玉米单产有望在即将到来的收获季节创下历史新高，但高温和疾病的影响可能会影响结果。【原文：US corn yields are expected to reach a record high for the upcoming harvest, though the impact of hot temperatures and diseases may affect the outcome, according to final estimates released Friday by Pro Farmer following the end of its annual crop tour.】

item.title: 道琼斯工业指数创下今年首个收盘纪录
item.description: 在跨资产大涨的推动下，道琼斯工业平均指数（Dow Jones Industrial Average）自 12 月份以来首次创下历史新高，因为这一稳健的蓝筹股指数终于赶上了股市中风险较高的股票。【原文：A blistering cross-asset rally drove the Dow Jones Industrial Average to close at an all-time high for the first time since December as the staid blue-chip gauge finally caught up to the riskier corners of the stock market.】

item.title: 鲍威尔讲话后股市大涨，VIX 指数降至圣诞夜以来最低水平
item.description: 上周五，Cboe 波动率指数（VIX）跌至年内最低水平，原因是美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）发表了备受期待的讲话，为 9 月份降息提供了支持，美股因此大涨。【原文：The Cboe Volatility Index (VIX) fell to its lowest level of the year on Friday, as US stocks surged following a highly-anticipated speech from Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell that bolstered the case for a September interest-rate cut.】

item.title: 关于杰克逊霍尔会议的更多信息（播客）
item.description: 我们还在杰克逊霍尔参加堪萨斯城联邦储备银行的年度经济研讨会，刚刚聆听了美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔的重要讲话。这次演讲为 9 月降息打开了大门，对市场来说是一个鸽派的惊喜，股市也因此飙升。但为什么鲍威尔决定把重点放在他所认为的劳动力市场的 "下行 "风险上，而不是通胀的 "上行 "风险上呢？在本期节目中，我们采访了彭博社电视台的迈克尔-麦基（Michael McKee）。【原文：We’re still at the Kansas City Federal Reserve Bank’s annual economic symposium in Jackson Hole, where we just heard Fed Chair Jerome Powell’s big speech. The speech — which opened the door to a September rate cut — proved to be a dovish surprise to the market and stocks are now soaring because of it. But why did Powell decide to focus on what he sees as “downside” risks to the labor market as opposed to “upside” risks to inflation? On this episode, we speak to Bloomberg TV’s Michael McKee, who’】

item.title: 暴雪联合创始人的游戏初创公司在产业过剩中挣扎
item.description: 视频游戏巨头暴雪娱乐公司（Blizzard Entertainment）的联合创始人迈克-莫海姆（Mike Morhaime）本周给他的新公司 Dreamhaven 的员工写了一封信，他希望自己不必写这封信。【原文：Mike Morhaime, a co-founder of video-game giant Blizzard Entertainment, sent a letter to staff at his new company Dreamhaven this week that he wished he didn’t have to write.】

item.title: 银行交易受阻后，Blackstone 接洽 Justrite 债务事宜
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Justrite Safety Group 正寻求在私人信贷市场上获得约 7 亿美元的债务，而该公司一直在广泛的银团市场上寻求融资。【原文：Justrite Safety Group is looking to the private credit market for approximately $700 million in debt, according to people familiar with the matter, while the firm has been seeking financing in the broadly syndicated market.】

item.title: 苹果称前员工和中国 OPPO 窃取商业机密
item.description: 苹果公司在一桩诉讼中指控智能手机制造商Oppo高薪挖走了Apple Watch团队的一名成员，并怂恿他在中国公司的新工作中窃取商业机密。【原文：Apple Inc. accused smartphone maker Oppo in a lawsuit of poaching a highly paid member of the Apple Watch team and encouraging him to steal trade secrets for his new job with the Chinese firm.】

item.title: 美联储独立之争的利害关系
item.description: 几个月来，唐纳德-特朗普总统一再批评美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔保持利率稳定。特朗普希望降低利率，并誓言要用更听话的人取代任期将于2026年结束的鲍威尔。总统在8月12日表示，他正在考虑就央行总部的翻修问题对鲍威尔提起诉讼，该项目成本超支引起了外界的关注。8月22日，特朗普升级了他对美联储独立性的攻击。【原文：For months, President Donald Trump has repeatedly criticized Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell for keeping interest rates steady. Trump, who wants rates cut, has vowed to replace Powell, whose term as chair ends in 2026, with someone more compliant. The president said on Aug. 12 that he is weighing a lawsuit against Powell over the renovation of the central bank’s headquarters, a project whose cost overruns have drawn scrutiny. On Aug. 22, Trump escalated his campaign against the Fed’s indepen】

item.title: 勒索软件黑客攻击橙色电信，数据在暗网上公布
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，一个黑客犯罪团伙窃取了法国电信公司 Orange SA 的商业客户数据，并将其发布到网上。【原文：A criminal hacking gang has stolen business customer data from French telecommunications company Orange SA and posted it online, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: MEG Energy 股东将投票反对 Cenovus 的收购
item.description: 斯特拉斯科纳资源有限公司（Strathcona Resources Ltd.）创始人亚当-沃特乌斯（Adam Waterous）表示，他的公司将投票反对Cenovus能源公司（Cenovus Energy Inc.【原文：Strathcona Resources Ltd. founder Adam Waterous said his company will vote against Cenovus Energy Inc.’s acquisition of MEG Energy Corp., saying the oil sands producer’s board accepted an inferior offer in an attempt to thwart his own bid.】

item.title: 特朗普将于周五公布英特尔股权交易方案
item.description: 熟悉该计划的人士称，特朗普政府和英特尔公司准备在周五公布一项协议的细节，该协议将让美国政府获得这家芯片制造商的股权。【原文：The Trump administration and Intel Corp. are poised to announce details on Friday of an agreement to give the US government an equity stake in the chipmaker, people familiar with the plan say.】

item.title: 苹果探索使用谷歌双子座人工智能为改版 Siri 提供支持
item.description: 苹果公司（Apple Inc. ）正在就使用谷歌双子座（Google Gemini）为改良版 Siri 语音助手提供动力进行早期讨论，这标志着该公司可能向外包更多人工智能技术迈出关键一步。【原文：Apple Inc. is in early discussions about using Google Gemini to power a revamped version of the Siri voice assistant, marking a key potential step toward outsourcing more of its artificial intelligence technology.】

item.title: 机构称洛杉矶和三藩市枢纽对加州高速铁路至关重要
item.description: 根据一份新的机构审查报告，加州高速铁路管理局预计将于 2032 年开始在拖延已久的旧金山至洛杉矶线路的中央山谷段提供客运服务，这比监察长之前的报告估计的时间至少提前了一年。【原文：The California High-Speed Rail Authority expects to begin passenger service on the Central Valley segment of its long-delayed San Francisco-to-Los Angeles line by 2032, at least a year earlier than a previous Inspector General report estimated, according to a new agency review.】

item.title: 智利总统候选人卡斯特承诺鼓励投资
item.description: 智利右翼总统候选人何塞-安东尼奥-卡斯特（Jose Antonio Kast）在其政府计划中承诺，将取消对部分股票销售征收的资本利得税，并刺激投资以推动经济增长。【原文：Chile right-wing presidential candidate Jose Antonio Kast pledged to scrap a capital gains tax on some stock sales and spur investment to propel economic growth, according to the front-runner’s government plan.】

item.title: 欧盟认为即使没有主权地位，其债券市场也将不断发展
item.description: 尽管欧盟加入主权债务指数的努力至今未果，但欧盟仍希望其债券市场能通过进一步的发行计划和期货合约继续发展。【原文：The European Union expects its bond market to continue to develop with further issuance programs and futures contracts, even though its push to join sovereign debt indexes has failed so far.】

item.title: 医疗补助削减 "摧毁 "了农村医院的融资选择
item.description: 哥伦比亚 Threadneedle 投资公司称，唐纳德-特朗普总统的 "美丽大法案 "中通过的医疗补助削减措施可能会将乡村医院系统挤出市政债券市场。【原文：The Medicaid cuts passed in President Donald Trump’s “Big Beautiful Bill” could push rural hospital systems out of the municipal bond market, according to Columbia Threadneedle Investments.】

item.title: 瑞典检察官撤销对 Alecta 公司调查中的两项贿赂指控
item.description: 根据彭博新闻社看到的官方文件，负责调查 Alecta 公司的瑞典检察官撤销了对该养老基金的两项所谓严重贿赂指控。【原文：Swedish prosecutors probing Alecta have dropped two counts of so-called aggravated bribery against the pension fund, according to official documents seen by Bloomberg News.】

item.title: 碧桂园警告上半年亏损可能扩大至 30 亿美元
item.description: 碧桂园控股有限公司称其上半年亏损可能高达 30 亿美元，中国旷日持久的房地产危机继续拖累这家陷入困境的开发商。【原文：Country Garden Holdings Co. said its first-half loss could reach as high as $3 billion with the China’s prolonged property crisis continuing to weigh on the the embattled developer.】

item.title: 华尔街从鲍威尔那里获得其所期待的反弹信号
item.description: 在本月的大部分时间里，华尔街的交易员们纷纷涌入股票和债券市场，押注美联储终于准备好再次降息。他们所等待的只是杰罗姆-鲍威尔开绿灯，让涨势继续下去。【原文：For much of this month, Wall Street traders piled into stocks and bonds, betting that the Federal Reserve was finally ready to start cutting interest rates again. All they were waiting on was the green light from Jerome Powell to keep the rally going.】

item.title: Spirit 借现金降低违约风险后评级被下调
item.description: 穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）将精神航空公司（Spirit Airlines）的信用等级下调两级，降至 Caa3，此前这家陷入困境的航空公司已从其循环信贷机制中提取了 2.75 亿美元，以避免现金短缺。【原文：Moody’s Ratings downgraded the creditworthiness of Spirit Airlines by two notches, to Caa3, after the beleaguered airline drew down $275 million of its revolving credit facility to avert a cash crunch.】

item.title: 矿山被查封后阿联酋全球铝业公司将撤离几内亚
item.description: 阿联酋全球铝业公司（Emirates Global Aluminium）表示，在几内亚的铝土矿被政府征用后，该公司在几内亚的铝土矿开采业务将终止。【原文：Emirates Global Aluminium said its bauxite mining operations in Guinea will be brought to an end after its mine was expropriated by the government.】

item.title: 安抚市场的智利财政部长意外离职令交易员大跌眼镜
item.description: 前财政部长马里奥-马塞尔（Mario Marcel）帮助将智利的风险意识降至多年来的最低水平，这对于一个原本打算彻底改革智利自由市场经济并支持重写宪法的政府来说并非易事。他周四的意外辞职令交易员们感到震惊。【原文：Former Finance Minister Mario Marcel helped reduce the perception of risk in Chile to the lowest level in years, no mean feat in a government that originally intended to overhaul the country’s free-market economy and backed a rewrite of the constitution. His surprise resignation Thursday jolted traders.】

item.title: 事故影响经济复苏，Codelco 下调铜矿指导价格
item.description: Codelco 公司下调了生产指标，因为其最大矿山发生的致命事故阻碍了该公司从矿石质量恶化中恢复的努力，损害了该公司继续保持世界顶级铜供应商地位的机会。【原文：Codelco lowered its production guidance after a fatal accident at its biggest mine hindered efforts to recover from deteriorating ore quality, hurting the company’s chances of remaining as the world’s top copper supplier.】

item.title: 美国银行股因降息押注而创下三年来首个纪录
item.description: 在投资者猜测美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）发出下月降息的信号后，美国银行股的一个重要指标创下了自2022年1月以来的首个收盘纪录。【原文：A key gauge of US bank stocks headed for its first record close since January 2022, with the latest leg higher coming after investors speculated Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell signaled a willingness to cut rates next month.】
